oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Semiconducting camphoric carbon tubules
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: MUKHOPADHYAY, K
KRISHNA, KM
SHARON, M
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: nanotubes
microtubules
c-60
camphor
soot
tubules
semiconductor
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Semiconducting carbon tubules (n- and p-type) of band gap 1.96-1.98 eV have been synthesised from the soot of naturally occurring camphor for the first time. The mechanism of the formation of multichannel-multilayered camphoric tubules is discussed. Tubules are characterised by SEM, AFM, TEM, XRD, ESR, FTIR and electrical conductivity studies.
